title: Connect to REST API with External IdP Token
content:
To connect to REST API with External IdP (Identity Provider) Token, you must do the following:

  1. Configure the IdP information in Identity Management (IdM) by following the steps in the Configure authentication services (LDAP, SAML, OAuth) section.
     
    IdM uses the configured Userinfo Endpoint to validate the <IdP access token>. Make sure that the Userinfo Endpoint is available in IdP and configured correctly in Identity Management (IdM). The response from the Userinfo Endpoint must include a user attribute mapped to the Username Attribute field in the Identity Management (IdM) OAuth2 configuration.
  2. Log in to SMAX service portal https://<custom domain>/saw/ess?tenantid=<tenant id> as OAuth2 user. The new user is automatically created in SMAX.
  3. Log in to SMAX agent, https://<custom domain/dashboard?tenantid=555500008 as Tenant Admin user. Assign the related SMAX user permissions to new user created in the previous step.
  4. Run the REST API with oauth2 access token issued by external IdP (for example, Azure):
  • API URL: <SMAX API URL>
  • Headers:  Authorization: Bearer <Oauth2 IdP Access Token>
    X-Auth-Group: <auth group  name in idm>  ## [Optional] Specify which authentication group is used to validate the received <IdP Access Token>. If not specified, IdM uses the default authentication group with api-default=true.
